titleStmt.title: Deaths advantage; opened in a sermon preached at Northampton, at the funeral of Peter Whalley Esq; then mayor of the said town. And now upon the earnest desires of his friends published by Edward Reynolds. D.D.
titleStmt.author: Reynolds, Edward, 1599-1676.

titleStmt.title: Deaths advantage; opened in a sermon preached at Northampton, at the funeral of Peter Whalley Esq; then mayor of the said town. And now upon the earnest desires of his friends published by Edward Reynolds. D.D.
titleStmt.author: Reynolds, Edward, 1599-1676.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Tho Newcomb for George Thomason, and are to be sold at his shop at the Rose and Crown in Pauls Church yard,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy (E.912[6]): "May 30" also Thomason has added "Stationer" following Peter Whalley's name and "St" before 'Pauls'.
Reproductions of the originals in the British Library.
